channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-17659] get_token thrift call fails for DBTokenStore in remote HMS mode
item.description: The get_token(String tokenIdentifier) HMS thrift API fails when HMS is deployed in remote mode and when there is no token found with that tokenIndentifier. This could happen when an application calls a renewDelegationToken on an expired/cancelled delegation token. The issue is that get_token tries to return a null result values which cannot be done in Thrift. The API call errors out with org.apache.thrift.TApplicationException unknown result exception which is uncaught and HS2 thrift server closes the client transport. So no further calls from that connection can be accepted unless client reconnects to HS2 again.
item.summary: get_token thrift call fails for DBTokenStore in remote HMS mode

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I don't think its a good idea to modify the public Thrift API now to return an Thrift wrapper object instead of String due to compatibility reasons. Attaching a simple a fix which returns empty string when token is not found.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12889808/HIVE-17659.01-branch-2.patch

Hi aihuaxu Can you please take a look?

I see. Ideally we need to create a wrapper class with the returned token to be optional field, but seems it's safe to return empty for this particular thrift call.

+1.
